issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After stopping an instance it failed to start due to the following error:
{code}
2014-01-27 17:36:58  INFO 000001533 VSphereEndpoint          | session with vSphere endpoint apiType=VIRTUALCENTER apiVersion=5.1 reponse=259ms
2014-01-27 17:36:58 DEBUG 000001533 hereConfigurationManager | polling hosts on endpoint https://10.111.1.133/sdk
2014-01-27 17:36:59 DEBUG 000001838 VSphereInstance          | Setting scsi id 0 for volume vol-0AF645E1
2014-01-27 17:36:59 DEBUG 000000792 Volumes                  | VolumeStateUpdate: PARTI00 vol-0AF645E1 EXTANT 2014-01-27 17:32:35.241 attachment i-364140CB attached storage-volume available=>EXTANT 3GB snap-1D613C2B 2014-01-28T01:32:35.000Z  end-state EXTANT
2014-01-27 17:36:59  INFO 000001838 BrokerInstance           | 10.111.5.100: updated in DB instance i-364140CB
2014-01-27 17:36:59 DEBUG 000001838 VSphereEndpoint          | 10.111.1.133: {1838} released session read lock
2014-01-27 17:36:59 ERROR 000001838 VSphereEndpointAsync     | creation of instance failed
com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Can't get datastore's summary. Connection to the server was possible lost.
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereHost.getDatastoreSummary(VSphereHost.java:663)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereHost.getDatastoreById(VSphereHost.java:650)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpoint.genConfigSpec(VSphereEndpoint.java:576)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpoint.createInstance(VSphereEndpoint.java:315)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpointAsync.access$801(VSphereEndpointAsync.java:40)
        at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpointAsync$5.call(VSphereEndpointAsync.java:313)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
2014-01-27 17:36:59  INFO 000001838 VSphereBrokerTaskFactory | 10.111.5.100: sending VSphereBrokerRunTask [E i-364140CB]: TaskOpEvent [FAILED]
2014-01-27 17:36:59  INFO 000002631 VSphereBrokerTaskFactory | 10.111.5.100: receiving VSphereBrokerRunTask [E i-364140CB]: TaskOpEvent [FAILED]
2014-01-27 17:36:59  INFO 000002631 BrokerInstance           | 10.111.5.100: goal change for instance i-364140CB: RUNNING -> NONE
{code}
fields.summary: VMware: Failure to start stopped instance

comments.body: [~viglesias], where can I find server config and full log?

[~vasya]
http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=vic-CI-maint-vmware-das&uid=1093

Logs should still be on the boxes. Othewise a SOS report can be found here:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/eutester-test-gather-logs/642/
This could have the same root as EUCA-8368
Base on the logs threads 000001525 and 000001533 got write lock and killed and refreshed session while thread 000001838 was still holding read lock :(.
[~viglesias] Are we able to reproduce this or is this a one off?

This does not have an easily reproducible case that I know of. It happens at least once in every QA run but at different times. Maybe [~vasya] or [~dmitrii] can provide some pointers to what they have seen in the past.

We strongly suspect that the error is non-deterministic. And each occurrence may look different from the other. We can discuss the commonalities at the meeting tomorrow. If our theory about this error is right, then it can be discovered through code inspection and verified by ensuring there are no random failures during VMware QA runs.

Relevent part of log:
{code}
